article.headline: McDonaldâs September sales get a boost from rapper Travis Scott
article.body: The Travis Scott Meal has been a popular choice since launching on September 8, analysts say McDonald's Analysts are upbeat about McDonaldâs Corp.âs September same-store sales thanks to the popularity of the newly-launched Travis Scott Meal, a combo created through a partnership between the fast-food giant and the Grammy-nominated rapper. Travis Scott, who is also known as Cactus Jack and is the founder of the label Cactus Jack Records, has a partnership with McDonaldâs MCD, -0.43% that includes the $6 combo. The Travis Scott Meal comes with a Quarter Pounder with cheese, bacon and lettuce; medium French fries with barbecue sauce; and a Sprite beverage. The meal launched on September 8 and will be available until October 4. iframe.twitter-tweet { width: 100% !important; } Thereâs also Cactus Jack + McDonaldâs merchandise and apparel, with McDonaldâs promising more to come. The last time a celebrityâs name was on the McDonaldâs menu was 1992 with Michael Jordan, according to the company. UBS conducted U.S. franchisee checks, finding that there was a âsignificant boost last weekâ from The Travis Scott Meal, raising same-store sales that were already up as much as double digits. âWe believe initial success of the promo could also drive greater trial of the fresh beef Quarter Pounder and attract younger customers to the brand,â wrote analysts led by Dennis Geiger. Read: Starbucksâ Pumpkin Spice Latte still drives traffic and could be a source of holiday season inspiration for retailers UBS rates McDonaldâs shares neutral and raised its price target to $230 from $215. Mark Kalinowski of Kalinowski Equity Research also thinks the promotion âseems to have gotten off to a great startâ and has raised his forecast for third-quarter same-store sales. Kalinowski rates McDonaldâs stock buy with a $243 price target. The FactSet consensus for McDonaldâs third-quarter same-store sales is a 5.3% decline. McDonaldâs is scheduled to report third-quarter earnings on October 27, according to FactSet. McDonaldâs will also get a bump from the launch of Spicy Chicken McNuggets, coming September 16. UBS anticipates âstrong trial and buzzâ based on a few factors, including the reception of the item in the U.K. in January. âWe believe McDonaldâs maintains among the best U.S. momentum in the sector, is defensive and well-positioned for a tighter consumer spending environment,â UBS said. See: Instant Pot has launched a coffee/espresso maker, the Instant Pod, available exclusively at Walmart Even with all of the qualities working in McDonaldâs favor, Kalinowski notes there are risks, including the ongoing coronavirus pandemic and growing competition, particularly from Wendyâs Co. WEN, +2.20% and its new breakfast menu and Chick-fil-A, perhaps McDonaldâs biggest threat. McDonaldâs stock is up 12.5% for the year to date while the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% has fallen 1.9% for the period.
